dialogues.text: Naomi and Erin climb a flight of stairs. Suddenly Erin sw a bit, dizzy. Naomi grips her arm, steadies her.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I’1l handle this one.  77 78 79 80 63 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I’ve got it. Erin pushes on.

dialogues.speaker: PHILADELPHIA BRIDGE, (STOCK FOOTAGE)
dialogues.text: Title Card: PHILADELPHIA

dialogues.speaker: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: 77 78 The same Conference Room with new production design and n extras. Investors elbow each other out of the way to reach a plat cookies shaped like keys. An INVESTOR approaches Ed and Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTOR
dialogues.text: I know the experts are impressed by your encryption, but let’s say I’m a hacker and I break into your server. The crowd gets quiet, interested. Naomi glances at Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well that’s the purpose of end-to- end encryption. Naomi nods.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Unencrypted content is never on the server. And don’t forget about ephemeral storage. Their confidence invigorates the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LYFT CAR. EVENING
dialogues.text: 79 80 Naomi watches the buildings of Manhattan sliding by, as s listens to a message.  64 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Forget thread count. I got new sheets woven from organic French flax plants. Naomi smiles, shakes her head. As she deletes the message reminder pops up on her phone: Dr. Romler, 4:30 p.m., tomorrow. Her expression sobers, as she returns to lookin out the window. 81 INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 81 Erin drags her suitcase behind her as she enters. Gabe gr papers, nursing a beer.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Hey babe! She kisses him. He squeezes her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I gotta go to bed. She heads for the bedroom. Gabe follows.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: You must be exhausted... 82 INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 82 Erin perches on the bed, already immersed in her blackber Gabe pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Don’t forget, doctor tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Oh fuck.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Wow. I was actually feeling pretty excited about it. Twelve weeks.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: It’s just-- there’s a lot going on. She starts pulling on her pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Yeah. There is. We need to talk.  65 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You want to talk now?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Look at this place-- where does the nursery go? Erin grabs her toothbrush. She scans the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I’m not commuting from Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Your promotion’1l cover a bigger place here.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Are you seriously putting that pressure on me right now?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: What? You’re the one who said-- She climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Not tonight. He looks at her a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I want to go back to school.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What                        !! She stares at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I’ve told you about these programs, to take your teaching to the next level--

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I can’t deal with this right now--

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Of course you can’t. I’1ll send you a fucking email. He heads back into the living room.  83 84 66 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 83 Naomi sleeps, curled on her side like a baby. Michael lie next to her, eyes open, watching her. He reaches out and gently brushes a hair out of her face. Naomi’s phone suddenly vibrates on the nightstand. Michae eyes go to the phone, its tiny flashing green light. He l at Naomi again, then the phone. He sits up, hesitates, an gingerly reaches over her to take the phone. Of course a passcode is needed. He looks at the number pa moment. Tries a number which doesn’t work. Naomi stirs in the bed. Michael freezes. She murmurs something inaudible. He leans over and replaces the phone lies back down, eyes still open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Melanie load the dishwasher, but Sam’s eyes are o her phone.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: That mug’s not dishwasher safe--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Then why do we own it?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Look, just let me do it--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m prepping for this--

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Interview. Sam meets her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can prep you. It’s a bunch of old white guys who have ALL the money...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They need good lawyers in Compliance to watch things from the inside, keep things legit.  67 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hey, do you want a sugar-mama or not? I’m trying to help support my wife so she can pursue her artistic... impulses.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Impulses? Babe, don’t pretend you’re doing this for me.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Doing what? Selling out?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Those are your words.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You do realize my salary MAXES OUT next year. Which is why nobody stays at the prosecutor's office--

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: What about Frank?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Frank lives in a studio in Hoboken! He does not have kids. He does not have a wife who has to see some out- of-network foot doctor for her tendinitis.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Wow-- I didn’t realize we were such a burden.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m just trying to live in the real world here! Suddenly she sees that Sophie has quietly entered the roo her pajamas. It’s unclear how much she has heard. SAM (CONT’D) Sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: I need some water. Sam goes to the sink and fills a glass with tap water.  85 68 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi sits on an exam table. Under the fluorescent lights a skimpy gown, she looks unusually vulnerable. A female doctor, pretty, and no-nonsense, examines her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I don’t see any other area of concern. Just this area here. She reaches out and touches the spot just where Naomi’s j meets her ear.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a typical squamous cell presentation.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: (Matter of fact) You’re saying I have skin cancer.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Well, this tissue may turn out to be malignant, yes. In most cases, it’s resolved when we remove the tissue.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: You can do that today?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We're going to have to schedule something...

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I want it gone. The doctor nods.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I may be able to squeeze you in next week.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Jesus. I’m going to be all over the news next week. I can’t have a fucking wound on my neck. What happens if I wait?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I would advise--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Is this thing is going to kill me?  86 69 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I’m not going to answer that. We need to remove the tissue, and--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I can do it September 5. Afternoon. The doctor regards her a little coolly.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You'll have to arrange that with my secretary. I’1ll let you get dressed. The doctor exits. Naomi slowly begins to get dressed. She looks around the room: a box of rubber gloves, a medical waste bin, a poster that shows grimacing cartoon faces expressing levels of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same chart of cartoon faces ranking pain. Erin lies on the table in the skimpy gown, as the technic moves the ultrasound wand over her belly. She and Gabe wa the movement on the screen. Gabe grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Can you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: No... She is a little awestruck. Her phone rings. Erin immediately reaches across Gabe to it out of her bag.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Erin. Hello? Hello? The technician and Gabe share a glance.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t get a signal.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Hon--

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: It’s that woman I told you about. She coaches people on the whole working mom thing--  87 88 89 70 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: She might tell you to enjoy your ultrasound. She takes this in. Looks back at the ultrasound screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, escorted by a SECURITY GUARD, walks onto a trading floor, taking it all in. A cavernous space filled with ro row of desks dwarfed by giant screens flashing ever-chang numbers. A conspicuous number of desks are empty. Financi news plays on additional screens on the walls. Sam watches, fascinated. A sleek young BROKER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BROKER
dialogues.text: You looking for something sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sweetheart? Seriously? Is this

dialogues.speaker: BROKER
dialogues.text: You look a little lost.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I thought it would be louder.

dialogues.speaker: BROKER
dialogues.text: Those were the old days.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Now you just rule the world by IM? He nods, cocky. She steps a little closer. On one screen notices the names of different cities, flashing along wit the numbers as the traders type in the eerie silence. She breathes it in, a slight smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 89
dialogues.text: 90 71 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. EVENING 90 Naomi works steadily, but she is beginning to fight exhaustion. She touches the spot on her jaw lightly. She flips through a bundle of messages; she likes what sh sees. She picks up her phone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Teddy, I’m just seeing these last- minute bids for shares. What else have we got?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Xandos and Redding are upping their orders. Naomi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: This thing is getting hot. Keep ‘em coming. She hangs up. She rubs her eyes, turns back to her comput Her assistant enters, sets down an espresso.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: You need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: No. She remains focused on her screen. The assistant hovers.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Everything go okay, with your appointment?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Of course. She resumes typing. The assistant hesitates just a moment more, then goes. Naomi glances at the window. She gathers up her briefcase coat. Turns to her assistant on her way out.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to finish up at home.  91 72 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin attempts to keep up with JULIE, a woman in an impecc suit, who is hurrying through the park, pushing a strolle

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I want to be strategic. Erin tries to catch a glimpse of the sleeping baby.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: First things first. Can you get named Managing Director before the baby comes? Second trimester is ideal.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know anymore. Naomi is looking out for her own promotion, and--

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Look, Naomi’s been your mentor, that’s nice. But let’s be real here. Julie approaches a bench where a Hispanic NANNY is waitin

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Julie speaks Spanish to the nanny, who nods and takes the stroller. Julie turns her attention immediately back to E

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much do you want this? Erin stares at her. She has never had to articulate this before.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because this is the moment. When people step off, they see some tiny blue booties, and they hesitate, and that’s it. You can’t hesitate. So how much do you want it?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I want it. I’ve always wanted it. My dad was a trader and when I was a kid I would put on his ties and beg him to take me to work, and --

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: That’s cute. But--

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: It’s all I ever wanted. Julie nods, convinced.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Then you need to forget about Naomi. You need someone who can reach over and bring you up. Now. Erin nods, she knows this is true.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who else are you networking with? You know anyone on the executive committee? Erin’s phone buzzes. She glances at it, doesn’t like what sees.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do what you need to do. EXT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT. NIGHT A92 INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 92 Naomi picks at a salad as she works on her laptop on the couch. She fingers the spot on her jaw again. She turns to the computer and googles “squamous cell.” Cl up photos of skin abnormalities appears. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it: Erin. She does not ans Looks back at the photos on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin approaches where Ed waits for her at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Hi, you got in okay? We need to talk about that email.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Whoa, you ever relax? Have a drink.  94 95 74 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I'd love to, but there’s a million things to do for tomorrow, and-- He puts a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: This place has an amazing view.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Ed... Ed puts his arm around Erin’s waist. She does not resist.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’ve gotta keep our eye on the ball here. Ed pulls Erin in for a kiss. She pulls away gently.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, these personnel changes you referred to--

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Come on Erin. You’re what, a VP? If I really want to talk business, I‘1l call Naomi. She looks at him, stung. She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Erin... She walks quickly through the lobby, the sounds and light blurring around her. Her foot catches on a luggage cart a she nearly crashes into two women with fur coats and shop bags. She pushes through, just trying to get to the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin emerges into the night air, steadying herself, breat hard. She pulls out her phone, scans her email, dials.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Naomi, call me when you get this. We may have a problem. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 95 Images of skin cancer still fill the laptop screen on Nao lap. But she has fallen asleep on the couch.  96 97

dialogues.speaker: 97B
dialogues.text: 75 Green Rev. (07/15/15) EXT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT BUILDING. NIGHT 96 Erin buzzes Naomi’s apartment. No answer. She turns to go INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 97 Michael reviews data on his computer, drinking a glass of wine. His buzzer sounds. He crosses to it.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Erin Manning. Surprised, he buzzes her up. EXT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 97A Erin walks into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m sorry to bother you, but I’m wondering if Naomi’s here?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Um no, she is not.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Something came up and I couldn’t get hold of her. I thought maybe--

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: She’s not at her place?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: No. Sorry for showing up here like this.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You're here, might as well have a glass of wine. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Really? I’m not interrupting you--

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Nah.  76 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She enters the apartment. He pours her a glass of wine. S surveys the space, noticing a framed photo of two teenage kids.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Your kids? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (Affectionately) Spoiled little shits. Mostly they visit me to piss off my ex. He hands her the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I won’t stay long.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’m not going to ask you about where else she spends the night. We’re all grown ups here. Erin smiles awkwardly at this, takes a sip of wine.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: This is nice. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it, shakes her head. Grabs pen from Michael's desk and jots something down.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You said something came up tonight? To do with Cachet? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s just... I can’t really go into it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Of course. I mean if you want to talk it through, we can keep it hypothetical--

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Naomi did mention you’d hit a snag, with due diligence. She looks up sharply.  77 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Naomi said that?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: She doesn’t go into detail, but I think we both find it helpful to talk things through, to get another perspective.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You’re telling me Naomi brings you across the wall?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No, not officially.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You know, she warned me about you. She told me once, you always have an agenda.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Well. She would know. He reaches over and pours more wine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s my agenda now?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You seem to think I’m going to give you information about my IPO.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Maybe I’m just enjoying the company. Erin takes a sip of wine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone’s got an agenda. You’ve been waiting on a promotion. You know that. I know that. And we know how these things happen. You do your work, kiss up to Naomi, and keep hoping this deal will be the one. Or you try other avenues. Erin just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been at Remson a long time. A lot of people there respect my opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Erin hesitates. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it. It’s Naomi. It buzzes again. Erin picks up.

dialogues.speaker: / ERIN
dialogues.text: Hi. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT -KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. INTER SCENES. Naomi pours herself some water.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I saw your messages.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Naomi-- I need to call you back.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why? You met with Ed, and what--

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Let me just - hang on a second-- She is looking at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you right now? Erin?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I am... at my place. Slowly she sits back down, holding the phone. Michael wat her. She hits speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yea, so, Ed tells me they did let go a few people last week.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was the recommendation.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I know, but-- one of them was Marin.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? She’s a liability! If she starts making claims about holes in the network--  98

dialogues.speaker: 98A
dialogues.text: 79 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Erin looks at Michael. He listens quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I know. Listen, I’ve got her number here. Michael’s fingers are hovering over his phone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Got it. Erin hangs up the phone. Michael looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Well, Erin, it’s been a pleasure. She stands, goes to the door, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: With what? She holds his gaze a moment and then goes into the hall, pulling the door closed behind her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE. NIGHT, (SAME HOTEL AS P. 71)
dialogues.text: Ed drinks a beer, reaching for his ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Hi Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You fired Marin. Now?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Look, it wasn’t my call. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 98A Naomi paces. INTERCUT SCENES.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Everything is your call.  99 100 80 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We've got it under control. She got a very nice severance, and our legal team had her sign all kinds of shit.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I’m concerned about this. I wish you had consulted me -

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Hey Naomi, news flash-- I don’t work for you. And I gotta tell you, the doubts, the second-guessing-- I’m getting tired of it. I mean we got orders pouring in, right?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: It’s my job to be thorough.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah? ‘Cause I thought it was your job to be inspiring. Ed hangs up. Naomi pulls out her Blackberry and looks at Marin’s phone number. She hesitates. She dials the number rings and rings. No answer. Naomi opens the fridge and takes out a bottle of wine, an the fish food. Naomi puts her face close to the glass of the fish tank. watches the glittery creature swim through the large tank completely unaware of her.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 99
dialogues.text: INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 100 Erin finds Gabe sleeping on the couch, in the flickering light of the TV. She makes a noise and he startles awake.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Hon, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: (Flatly) Nothing. She stares at his sleeping form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 103 104 81 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN. NIGHT Al01 Naomi kickboxes a little wildly, her trainer egging her o She wipes sweat from her brow. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. MORNING 101 Sam sits in a lotus position, attempting to meditate. She tries to ignore the sound of her phone vibrating, but her eyes keep popping open. Finally she gives up and she reac for her phone. A message from Cory: MADE CONTACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi’s team, Cachet management, and lawyers crowd the ro

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I want to thank you all for your patience, as we’ve been processing this terrific surge in orders from institutional investors. The order book is now closed, and we've got our offering price, $35. Nods of approval around the table. Ed fist bumps Ian.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cachet just raised $250 million. Ed grins, stands up as the room applauds. As people filte out of the room, Naomi notices the green pen that Erin is using to jot down notes.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did you get that pen?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: (Genuine) I don’t know. She tosses it in her bag and leaves the room with the oth

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Color of money.  105 106 107 82 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Naomi stares after Erin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is outside the pub, looking in. He sees Benji wai for him. He takes a breath and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes a seat next to Benji and Cory at the bar. T drink.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Cory and I have a bet on how much you spent on my birthday present.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: To many more. Michael slides a large wrapped box across the bar. Benji it open. Inside is the stuffed hedgehog, with a bow aroun its neck.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Nice. Benji sets the hedgehog on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grills Cory, who sits with his Attorney.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What, like a porcupine??

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Hedgehog. But cute, fuzzy. Get it? Hedge fund? Money hog?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I get it. And Benji took it with him?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Yup. He reaches under his collar and pulls out a microphone, h it to her.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that it?  108 109 110 83 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me? You belong to us. INT. GREENSLEEVES PUB MEN’S ROOM. EVENING 108 Benji fingers a pocket knife. He waits for a man to finis using the urinal and exit. He cuts into the stuffed anima belly, and pulls out a tiny slip of paper pushed into the stuffing. Tiny handwriting -- a phone number and the name: Marin. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. NIGHT 109 Naomi begins to shut down her computer when she spots the Google alert. She clicks on it. A blog post. The headline is: “Cachet IPO Not a Secure Thing.” Naomi sees the words: “Former Cachet employee.” Naomi dials Marin. There is some fumbling as Marin actual picks up, her voice quivering a little.

dialogues.speaker: MARIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Marin, it’s Naomi Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marin speaks quietly from the driver’s seat of her messy INTERCUT SCENES.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Do you understand what’s happening here? Cachet can sue you.

dialogues.speaker: MARIN
dialogues.text: They said they would take care of all that.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Who did? Who said that? Are they paying you?

dialogues.speaker: MARIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.  111 84 Green Rev. (07/15/15) And she hangs up. Naomi turns back to her screen, staring the photo of the blogger: Marco Evans. Naomi dials her phone again.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Get me a car to Brooklyn. South Slope. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 111 Melanie holds open the door a crack, the chain on. She se Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I'm a friend of Sam's. Melanie looks her over, recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Nice shoes.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Thank you. Melanie opens the door. William and Sophie perch on tall kitchen stools, devouring boxed mac & cheese.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Let me grab her. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Hi there. You must be William?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I don’t talk to strangers.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: That's fine, but it’s really your friends that will stab you in the back. William considers this. Sam enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Naomi. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I want you to tell me what you know. About Michael.  112 85 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Sam glances at Sophie and Mel.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why don’t we go into my office. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM. NIGHT 112 The small bedroom doubles as the “office”, A standing des in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: You’ve been investigating him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can’t really comment on that.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Somebody leaked rumors about my IPO. I’m doing this IPO, and somebody--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: The tech blogger, who broke the story? That’s an old friend of Michael’s. From Stanford. It had to be him, right?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you think it was? Naomi hears this. Realizes she may be about to give somet away instead of getting something. SAM (CONT’D) Look, as far as this IPO goes, we don’t have any specific link to Michael at this time. Except you. You're the link.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Wait-- are you saying I gave him information?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m not saying anything. Naomi is on guard now. Realizing this is a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I should go.  113 86 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You don’t have to go. I can help you. Did he--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: He did not get this from me. Do you understand that? That is not who I am. She turns and heads rapidly back through the apartment, h heels clicking on the floor as she exits. INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 113 An unshaven, tired-looking Michael lets Naomi into the lo They look at each other a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Are you tanking my IPO? Michael pours wine into two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Should I be?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I swear Michael. Do not fuck with me on this. Did you leak this thing?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter if it’s true! You know that. Once the rumors start -

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Start your own rumors. You know how to play this. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?! I had this. This was mine and you fucked me. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you take my phone one night when I was sleeping? Or was it Erin? Did she tell you something? He smiles faintly.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a wire?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Lets take our clothes off. Find out. For a moment, we think she’s going to do this.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Wow. It really is all just a big game to you, isn’t it -- all of it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What else is there? He seems to be really asking. She takes this in. She crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, whatever happens tomorrow. You'll be fine. Something bursts in her.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Fine? I do not want to be fine. I did not work my ass off for 20 years for FINE!! I’m not supposed to be fine! I am supposed to be a rainmaker.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 114
dialogues.text: INT. NAOMI’‘S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. 3AM 115 Naomi paces around like a caged tiger, on Various phone calls.  116 117 118 88 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: No, that’s for PR to handle. They got a long reach. Hang on--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can discredit her. There’s a history of psychological problems. Yes, depression, mania...

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m looking at the report from our Hong Kong security guys. I mean if those guys can’t figure out the hack--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please tell Ed that will not be necessary. I mean I appreciate his creativity, but-- look, just wake the fuck up and call me. She hangs up, rubs her eyes, and brews more espresso. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. 5 A.M. 116 Erin struggles to zip her skirt over the beginnings of a “bump.” She check out the profile of her body in the mirr tugs at the skirt. Gabe sleeps peacefully in the bed. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. MORNING. 5 A.M. 117 Naomi applies concealer on her neck, covering the patch o skin that the doctor had examined. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. MORNING 5. A.M. 118 Sam can’t sleep. She reaches over a sleeping Melanie and grabs her computer. Goes to Bloomberg, sees: “CACHET GOES PUBLIC TODAY.” She clicks on a video. A Bloomberg reporter is interviewi Ed and Ian.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So this is the big day for you and your shareholders.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Absolutely. There is a brief awkward moment where she waits for him t say more, then plunges forward.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Now just in the last 12 hours, reports have surfaced that hackers may be attempting to access this secure network? Ian looks like he is prepared to answer, but Ed goes firs

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I want to take this moment to personally reassure our investors. This morning, I have uploaded three photos to my own profile on the Cachet network. And I don’t mind telling you, that these photos, they are highly personal in nature. If you know what I mean. Ian jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What Ed means is-- there has been never been a security breach on this network, and --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: If anybody thinks they can access my photos, I say go ahead and try. Ian is still trying to get a word in.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Well, that certainly should be compelling to the investors out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin approaches the building and sees Naomi waiting for h

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen in there?  120

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Well, hopefully--

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Don’t give me that. Did you leak this?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I know you were with Michael that night.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I was not with Michael.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: If you sabotaged this thing... do you have any idea how stupid that is? What the fuck did you do?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I didn’t do anything!

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: You needed this.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: (quietly) You don’t know what I need. You never fucking did. Erin marches inside. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. MORNING Sam answers her phone as she quickly dresses.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello, Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: You need to look into Erin Manning, my VP on this deal.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Naomi?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: She had contact with Michael. 120

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’1l do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi and her team are at a bank of computers. She gazes at a large television showing live coverage of the stock exchange, in an echo of the first scene of the script: A mass of people humming with anticipation, traders shoutin photos flashing. Naomi turns her attention to the computer screen in front her, watching the quickly changing numbers of the share allocation.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: We’ve got FBA for 30,000 shares. Xandos for 50,000. She leans into a speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What have we got for foreign?

dialogues.speaker: BANKER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tioros requested 75,000. We’ve got China for 70. The graphs on the screen flicker and change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi oversees her team allocating the shares, her eyes darting from screen to screen.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Rexel Brothers requested 50,000 shares.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: I’ve got Cabreau Fund for 60.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Milton Group wants 50.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: We’ll have Boon Portfolio ina minute...

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Are we close?  123

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We've got Redding for 75.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: No, wait, Boon is out.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Boon’s hitting the exits.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Milton Ellis is pulling out too.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Fuck! She leans in to the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arthur, Jonathan, we have to anchor this thing.

dialogues.speaker: IPO REPORTER
dialogues.text: It’s 5 minutes to market open, and the underwriters of the highly anticipated Cachet IPO are nearly finished allocating shares to institutional investors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzz of anticipation on the floor. Ed, looking especially sharp, steps up and proudly rings opening bell.

dialogues.speaker: IPO REPORTER
dialogues.text: And the market is open! Privacy company Cachet goes public today, and we will be watching to see how that stock trends, and what time it’s going to trade--  124 93 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Restless energy on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 1
dialogues.text: I’ve got a bid for 100 at 32.

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 2
dialogues.text: 200 at 30. The screens change by the second, as Naomi and the team t orders coming in.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: What have we got?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We're getting it. Naomi glances up at the TV coverage of the NYSE, where th crowd is growing impatient.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: This thing’s gotta start trading-- An NYSE OFFICIAL cuts in on speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is there a problem over there?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: We're finishing the share allocation. Traders buzz with impatience. Naomi sees Randall approach

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: We need this price.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Jesus. People are pissing themselves. When are we opening?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: What’s the hold up?? What’s our fucking price? Naomi leans over Erin’s shoulder, trying to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: We're in the $29 to $31 range.  125 126

dialogues.speaker: HAPPEN
dialogues.text: Randall storms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael watches his screens, on the phone with Benji.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji, on his phone, watches his Lyft car pull up.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Hang on. My Lyft is here. He climbs into the car.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Talk to me. Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More chaos. On TV, we see/hear an ENERGETIC REPORTER:

dialogues.speaker: ENERGETIC REPORTER
dialogues.text: Now we've had our eye on this Cachet IPO all season. But trouble seems to be on the horizon, with whispers thatthis social network they’re promoting might be just as hackable as my neighbor's Wi-Fi. Erin and Bill are bent over the computer. Naomi hovers.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Twenty eight.  128 129 130 131 95 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: What                        ! Are you fucking kidding me. Get the desk. They better be buying. Erin nods and grabs the phone. We see/hear:

dialogues.speaker: IPO REPORTER
dialogues.text: Price discovery has just been completed on the IPO for the privacy company Cachet. The opening price of $28 has dropped significantly from the offering price of $35. We will be tracking the offering throughout the day. Naomi looks like a warrior in battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A portal with the Remson logo shows the share price dropp 28, 26, 24.

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 1
dialogues.text: I’ve got no ask!

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 2
dialogues.text: Where’s the fucking bottom on this one? Naomi addresses her team.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Come on guys. We can still stabilize this thing! Erin, on the phone, her face a mask of tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji, on his phone and laptop, watches the stock fall.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Wait for it. I want in at 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watches Bloomberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 P.M. On the floor: The American flag. DMM’s, sporting Cachet tee-shirts, swiftly type and log numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin vomits in the bathroom toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi watches the screens like a hawk. The price is $22. A trader on the floor suddenly jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 1
dialogues.text: Hang on we got bids coming in. Titanite is buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji’s eyes are on his phone. He nods, smiles, and strid from the lounge toward a waiting helicopter. He boards the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter ascends.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE. DAY, (SAME HOTEL AS SC 93)
dialogues.text: A somber Ed nurses a beer, watching the coverage from NYS TV. Ian takes the seat next to him, but Ed barely acknowledges him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3:57 PM. Closing time. Naomi’s fingers fly over the keyboard. Erin reaches over the next desk, holding out a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Get that out of my face.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You haven’t eaten anything. Naomi glances over at Teddy and Bill. They are typing quickly, while devouring giant chocolate chip cookies.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Get me one of those. She turns back to her computer, noticing something.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell. She picks up her phone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to know who the fuck thinks they’re going to make money off this train wreck! She hangs up. Bill is holding a large cookie out to her. takes it, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this??

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: You said-- She shoves it back towards Bill.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: How many chocolate chips are in my cookie?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Did anyone teach you basic math? Count the fucking chips.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I saw your cookies! They were oozing with chocolate. But my cookie has three goddamn chips                        ! Erin, Bill and a few others are staring at Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Someone get the woman a decent cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closing bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi stares up at the TV with the closing price: 23.74. The chaos around them begins to die down. Naomi turns and walks off the floor. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 141 Erin lies on the couch, Bloomberg on in the background. G enters, watches.

dialogues.speaker: IPO REPORTER
dialogues.text: Cachet lost nearly 20% of its market cap on this first day of trading... Erin shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: It didn’t go well?  142 143 144 99 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: You have no idea? I mean it didn’t occur to you, to turn on the TV today? He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Does it ever occur to you, in the middle of your day, to check on how my middle-schoolers are doing? Erin gets up in icy silence and disappears into the bedro Gabe considers following her, but settles down on the cou instead. INT. NAOMI’S KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 142 Naomi finishes the last of a bottle of wine, watching mut Bloomberg coverage on the exchange floor, focusing on the reporter’s mouth moving silently. Naomi stands, feeling the wine a little, and takes her wi glass to the kitchen. She stops abruptly, noticing that her fish is floating on top of the tank. She slowly puts out a finger and touches lifeless body. But her hand is shaking. Her whole body is shaking, final she is letting the tears come. She takes the fish tank and walks a bit unsteadily toward the bathroom. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM. NIGHT 143 Naomi gently tips the bowl so the fish drops into the toi Deliberately, she reaches to flush it, watching her fish sucked down into the swirling water. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. MORNING 144 Naomi gets dressed, as if it is any other workday. She lo at her reflection in the mirror, as if confirming some ki of pact with herself.  145 146 100 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. U.S. ATTORNEY’S OFFICE. DAY 145 Sam chews her nails as she and Frank survey spreadsheets.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Cory?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You left another message?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Look, we know Titanite was the only buyer for those shares.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: A few days go by, they get this Marin to retract her statement, the stock rallies--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And they clean up. But we need proof! We need Cory. Sam paces in front of her whiteboard, where she has added Erin’s name. SAM (CONT’D) I hate this!! Call your friend in Compliance. Ask her to send us the personnel file for Erin Manning.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She’s not going to do that.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Because she says this is starting to resemble a witchhunt.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit. We are so close. She fixes her gaze on the whiteboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi moves through the bank. She feels that all eyes are her.  147 148 149 101 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Her assistant whispers with a younger, prettier assistant They get quiet the minute they see her. She goes right pa them into her office. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 147 Naomi scans her schedule on the computer furiously as she talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I see. No, I was not made aware of that. Thank you. She bangs down her the phone and goes to where she can se the two assistants still huddling.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is canceling my meetings? Her assistant looks back at her, a deer in the headlights Naomi strides past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin stands at her desk, looking a bit unsure what to do first. A woman pops her head in her office.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Erin, Compliance is asking for you. Erin gets up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cory’s Attorney stands up when he sees Sam approach.

dialogues.speaker: ATTORNEY CAHN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to tell you this. She stares at him. ATTORNEY CAHN (CONT’D) There’s been an accident. I don’t know if you were aware that Cory had a drug problem - Sam shakes her head. ATTORNEY CAHN (CONT’D) Looks like an overdose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 151 102 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Sam’s face, stunned. EXT. SAM’S APARTMENT. DAY A150 Sam walks slowly up to her building. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM. DAY 150 Water runs over Sam as she stands in the shower. We hear knocking at the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Babe? You okay? Sam does not answer. Knocking continues as she slumps aga the tile, her makeup runs down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby sits across from Erin.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I know you’re familiar with the regulations that keep the investment banking transactions separate from sales and trading.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Did you have contact with Michael Connor three days before the Cachet offering?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry-- do I need a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Well essentially we are your lawyers. For the moment.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Right. I spoke to Michael that night, briefly, about a colleague.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You didn’t discuss the Cachet deal?  152 153 103 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: No. What did Michael tell you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Michael Connor no longer works at the firm. Erin's face. She was not expecting this. INT. RECEPTION OUTSIDE RANDALL’S OFFICE. DAY 152 Naomi sees one of the slick Channing Trust bankers from t original pitch leaving Randall’s office, HR woman at his side. He glances up, nods cordially to Naomi. She just stares a him. Marches past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi enters. Randall tugs on a Jenga block. The tower quivers but rema standing.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: That was him? Your new Global Head?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (Looking at the blocks) Thing about this game is, no matter how you play, it always comes crashing down in the end.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Look at me. Have the respect to look me in the eye and tell me if that man out there is my new boss. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: This department needs a new face.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Don’t give me that--

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You lost control of the story!  154 155 104 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Cachet will rally. Look at Facebook.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Naomi. It’s like I told you. This just isn’t going to be your year. She stares at him, simmering.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Yeah? When is my year?? Tell me, when is my fucking year?! Randall says nothing. She looks at him, realizing that he day is not going to come, not within these walls. She tak deep breath. She turns to the Jenga blocks, and taking th exact one she wants, causes the tower to topple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi walks through the bank, her head held high, still holding the Jenga block. When she gets to her office she that a security guard is already waiting for her. She hands him her blackberry. She looks around her office potted plant. A coffee mug. A dish of mints. The Lucite trophies, one for each successful deal. She does not take anything with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin hurries towards Michael’s office. A FEMALE SECURITY GUARD is packing up odd and ends. Erin stops in the doorw watching. Trader 1 approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 3
dialogues.text: Lucky bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Michael?

dialogues.speaker: TRADER 3
dialogues.text: Got a job at Titanite.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: The hedge fund.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: That’s where the big bucks are these days, huh.  105 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She takes a tin of chocolate espresso beans out of a desk drawer. FEMALE SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Coffee bean? Erin just shakes her head. 156 INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 156 Erin approaches Naomi’s office only to see that she too i gone. Security is taking the computer. Erin watches a moment. Teddy and Bill approach, stand next to her in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: .+-Did you see her?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Nobody wants to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What happens to the rest of us?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Well apparently, Erin is moving up in the world. She looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My uncle called me this morning, asking about you. I told him you’re a pro.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: They've got some HUGE deal coming up. He wants to know if you give 100%. Cause he said this thing would be your whole life. So I told him, that’s your dream. Erin just looks at him. She glances down, and realizes he hand is resting on her belly. And she nods.  106 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi exits the bank. The building looks huge and imposin behind her. She glances up at it. And starts to walk away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters the gleaming lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam faces a glossy CORPORATE LAWYER.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORATE LAWYER
dialogues.text: You do have a reputation for being a bit... unorthodox. Sam tries to turn this into a positive.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I try to get the job done however I can. The corporate lawyer nods, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORATE LAWYER
dialogues.text: This would be a big transition for you, coming over to the corporate side...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The thing is, I need to make some money. I have a family, and... no, it’s not even that. The truth is... I want to make some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Sam’s words continue over the images of the tradi floor.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You want me to say something a little more nuanced? Something about my dreams, and my passions? I can. But money doesn’t have to be a dirty word...

dialogues.speaker: 162A
dialogues.text: 163 107 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT -KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. DAY 162 Naomi, dressed casually but chic, enters the apartment, w a box. Naomi’s phone buzzes. She checks, sees Michael’s name. Na hits “ignore” on the phone. She rips open the box and pulls out a new fish tank, whic separated into three sections by glass walls. She looks at the instructions on the box: Caution: Betas must be in divided tank, fatalities will occur. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT -KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. LATER 162A Three bright fish now swim in each section of the tank. Naomi, in pajamas, watches the fish as she drinks her cof and eats chocolate chips from the bag. She has a tiny gau bandage on the spot on her neck. She looks around the apartment a minute, her gaze falling her closed laptop. Her eye falls on her punching bag in the corner. Suddenly she gets up and crosses to it. She lunges forward, hittin the bag hard. She hits it again and again, hurting her ba hands. She reaches for a small bag containing her gloves, pausing a moment to read lettering on the bag: “A champion is someone who gets up when he can’t.” Jack Dempsey Naomi pulls on her gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands in a wide vista, teeing up. From a great distance, he sees Naomi slowly making her way over the gr He watches her come closer. She stops a few feet away from him. She wears jeans and a sweater. Her hair is loose around h shoulders. She looks beautiful in the early morning light He nods to her.  164 108 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're here to play? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: No. She waves her hand at the course.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not ready for all this. I’m not done. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I’ve got a proposal for you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah? You setting up shop? What’s the strategy? She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Walk with me. She takes his arm. They walk together over the green.

dialogues.speaker: OVER CREDITS
dialogues.text: We see a graph tracking the Cachet stock from opening day over the next few weeks. The stock has begun to rally ina steady upward climb.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOMBERG REPORTER
dialogues.text: And there are murmurs on the street that Banker Naomi Bishop may be setting up her own shop in private equity. A potential LP the new venture tells us that Bishop is developing innovative ideas for new market opportunities... We pull back to see more graphs, tracking more stocks, tracking the overall market as it dips and soars.  109 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
